result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Thomas Holman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT, with balance due up to 25% of prison funds; and to be paid on or before the end of your ES. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
- ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying within its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000.00 fine or both. Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1). Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Thomas Holman

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Milwaukee County Early Intervention Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Willie Thomas Holman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.    Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOWS:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due up to 25% of prison funds; and to be paid on or before the end of your Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  7 Letters
Letters from defense for sentencing received and filed./ds

Defendant Willie Thomas Holman in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final Pretrial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea; forms submitted.  Hearing proceeded.  The state WITHDRAWS Amended Information filed on 9-08-15.  Defendant to plea to charges reflected in Count 1 of the Original Information.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1 OF ORIGINAL INFORMATION:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Defense request for adjourned sentencing date granted.  Jury trial date of 9-16-15 removed from the calendar at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
***WITHDRAWN BY THE STATE ON 9-11-15***
AMENDED Information filed.
State's Witness List, filed.
Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
